meanings.definition: A substance with no therapeutic effect, used as a control in testing new drugs.
meanings.sent1: The researchers gave some participants placebos to compare the effects of the new drug.
meanings.sent2: Doctors sometimes use placebos in studies to see if a new medicine really works.
meanings.sent3: The placebo pills were like secret agents, pretending to be real medicine.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a placebo, hiding the worry she felt inside.
meanings.sent5: The placebo was a ghost, present but without any real power.

meanings.definition: A harmless pill, medicine, or procedure prescribed more for the psychological benefit to the patient than for any physiological effect.
meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed placebos to help the patient feel better mentally.
meanings.sent2: Sometimes, a placebo can make a person feel better just by believing it will work.
meanings.sent3: The placebo was like a magic charm, making the patient believe in their recovery.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter acted as a placebo, lifting the spirits of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The placebo was a ray of hope in the patient's journey to wellness.

meanings.definition: A substance containing no medication and prescribed or given to reinforce a patient's expectation to get well.
meanings.sent1: The placebo was given to boost the patient's confidence in their recovery.
meanings.sent2: Using placebos can sometimes help patients feel more optimistic about their health.
meanings.sent3: The placebo was like a lucky charm, bringing good vibes to the patient.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude acted as a placebo, aiding in her healing process.
meanings.sent5: The placebo was a beacon of positivity in the patient's treatment plan.
